Create PRNG configuration using excellent discriminant

Source: R/excellent_discriminants.R
create_excellent_prng_config.Rd

Creates a complete PRNG configuration object from a single excellent discriminant parameter set. The configuration is optimized for high-quality random number generation.

Usage

create_excellent_prng_config(
  discriminant_params,
  precision = 256,
  use_crypto = TRUE
)

Arguments

discriminant_params

A single-row data frame from excellent discriminants containing columns a, b, c, discriminant, and overall_score

precision

MPFR precision in bits for calculations (default: 256)

use_crypto

Enable cryptographic mixing with ChaCha20 (default: TRUE)

Value

A list containing PRNG configuration:

a

Quadratic coefficient

b

Linear coefficient

c

Constant term

precision

MPFR precision in bits

use_parallel_filling

Set to FALSE for stability

use_cryptographic_mixing

ChaCha20 mixing flag

Details

The function creates a configuration optimized for production use:

  • Parallel filling is disabled to avoid performance issues

  • Cryptographic mixing is enabled by default for enhanced security

  • The discriminant parameters are validated to be from excellent set

The function also prints a summary of the configuration including the discriminant value and quality score.

Note

The discriminant_params must be a single row. Use indexing or subset operations if working with multiple discriminants.

See also

createPRNG, get_recommended_discriminants

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Get the best discriminant and create config
excellent <- load_excellent_discriminants()
best_discriminant <- excellent[1, ]
config <- create_excellent_prng_config(best_discriminant)

# Create config with custom precision
config_512 <- create_excellent_prng_config(best_discriminant, precision = 512)
} # }
